title: Workshop on improving language pedagogy using large-scale data-driven learning analytics: Strategies for enhancing text, vocabulary, and expressive skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience (grammar·vocabulary·reading), digital device proficiency, and SNS communication experience
context.additional_context: A course aiming to measure students' language learning outcomes (text comprehension, expression, lexical diversity) through learning analytics, provide data-driven personalized feedback, and build collaborative learning environments. Requires designing activities executable in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments. Emphasizes asynchronous text-based interaction and automated grammar error analysis.

learning_goals: Analyze learner data (reading/writing frequency, vocabulary usage patterns) to derive three instructional design strategies that improve language learning outcomes by ≥20%.
Design SNS-based collaborative learning activities to achieve ≥5 weekly interactions for text sharing and feedback among learners.
Use simple data visualization tools (smartphone apps) to analyze individual learners’ vocabulary acquisition and grammatical error patterns, generating customized feedback reports.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
